solution.content:
Write $f(x) = \ln(1+x^2)$.
We show that $y=ax+b$ intersects $y=f(x)$ in exactly one point if and only if $(a,b)$ lies in one of the following groups:
\begin{itemize}
\item
$a=b=0$
\item
$|a| \geq 1$, arbitrary $b$
\item
$0 < |a| < 1$, and $b<\ln(1-r_-)^2-|a|r_-$ or $b>\ln(1-r_+)^2-|a|r_+$, where 
\[
r_\pm = \frac{1\pm\sqrt{1-a^2}}{a}.
\]
